etymology.description: Ideogrammic: semantic 火 “fire” + semantic 𢍱 “to rise high” (two pairs of hands); simplified from 𤐫 with 火→示 and 𢍱→覀, later used for “token/label.”
etymology.interpretation: Combining fire with raised hands evoked sparks rising upward, a vivid image of lifting or flickering. That sense generalized to a “token/label,” which in later usage covers tickets, banknotes, and ballots as tangible proofs or markers.

examples.chinese: 我买了两张电影票(我買了兩張電影票)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le liǎng zhāng diànyǐng piào.

examples.chinese: 请出示车票(請出示車票)。
他把选票投进票箱(他把選票投進票箱)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ xuǎnpiào tóu jìn piàoxiāng.
examples.english: He cast the ballot into the ballot box.
